intro: Cymopterus trotteri, commonly known as the desert gourd, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
